page.title: 01A DISCRIPTION OF THE AREA
page.content:
Fifty percent of the block is shallow rocky sea with sandy areas.
The land area is principally rolling down land rising to 100 metres from rocky beaches and shallow cliffs composed of "Dartmouth Slates",i.e. light loam, 6 to 18 inches deep, over shale or shillot with rocky outcrops.
With the exception of the caravan site at Stoke House on the extreme west of the area the coastline is entirely undeveloped.
Inland from the coast there is a similar lack of development the land being principally cultivated by six farms.
There is one minor road with side roads, some of them unsurfaced.
